intro: Ecclinusa atabapoensis, commonly known as the Atabapo ecclinusa, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest region of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. Ecclinusa atabapoensis plays a role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various small organisms.
